intro: Frangula riojae, commonly known as Rioja's buckthorn, is a shrub native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers followed by dark, berry-like fruits. Its bark and leaves contain anthraquinones, which have been historically used in traditional medicine. Frangula riojae is adapted to survive in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
